name: Golden Retriever
description: The Golden Retriever is known for its signature traits—loyalty, intelligence, and trainability. Recognized for their confidence and affectionate nature, Golden Retrievers excel in family environments, working roles, and active lifestyles.

adaptability.description: Golden Retrievers adapt well to both hot and cold climates, thanks to their coat and overall resilience.

traits.description: These attributes have been rated by dog trainers, expert vets and pet behaviorists. Remember that all dogs are individuals with their own personalities.

diet.title: DIET
diet.subtitle: Consider following tips when choosing food for your Golden Retriever.
diet.mainDescription: Golden Retrievers thrive on a high-protein, balanced diet rich in animal-based proteins, healthy fats, and essential vitamins to support their active lifestyle and joint health.

tips.title: Choose a protein-rich diet
tips.description: Golden Retrievers are energetic; look for 18–25% protein for adults and higher for puppies to sustain activity and muscle health.

tips.title: Avoid fillers & additives
tips.description: Golden Retrievers should avoid foods with heavy fillers such as wheat and soy that may be difficult to digest or trigger sensitivities.

tips.title: Add Essential Fatty Acids
tips.description: Look for foods containing Omega-3 and Omega-6 fatty acids to support skin, coat, and joint comfort.

tips.title: Consider their age
tips.description: Choose an appropriate diet according to your Golden Retriever's age—puppies need more protein and fat for growth, while adult and senior dogs may require lower levels for weight maintenance.

training.title: GOLDEN RETRIEVER TRAINING
training.subtitle: Essential training tips to help your Golden Retriever thrive.
training.mainDescription: Golden Retrievers require regular exercise, proper grooming, socialization, and consistent training to maintain their physical health and mental well-being.

tips.title: Physical training and exercises
tips.description: Include activities such as running, playing fetch, swimming, agility training, or hiking in their routine.

tips.title: Interactive play
tips.description: Use scent-retention games and puzzle toys to provide mental stimulation and keep them engaged.

grooming.title: GROOMING
grooming.subtitle: Consider following tips when grooming your Golden Retriever.
grooming.mainDescription: Golden Retrievers have relatively low grooming needs despite their coat type. Here are some essential tips to ensure they shine.

tips.title: Brush and bath
tips.description: Brush regularly to remove loose hair and distribute natural oils. Occasional bathing keeps them clean and fresh.

tips.title: Keep their ears clean
tips.description: Check ears regularly and clean when required with a cotton ball and a mild ear-cleaning solution.

homeCookedFood.title: Home-Cooked Food Must Contain:
homeCookedFood.description: Preparing home-cooked meals may be time consuming and nutritionally incomplete, consider adding food toppers or supplements to make up for the lack of nutrients.
